title: Riot dun goofed
body: You can no longer qss zeds ult? What are we adc's supposed to do now{{item:3070}}

replies.body: Rely on your team to peel and your support to protect you. It's horrible, isn't it?

I know, right?

Who would've thought you have to do that in a team game?

Best strategy when playing ranked = Ban Zed :P

Best strategy when playing normals = Play super passive when you have no sight of Zed on the map; In team fights, focus the zed. If this fails and you get ulted by him, do whatever you can to get out of his range.

With the changes to QSS there really isnt much you can do as an adc anymore. Unless you build a Varus AP and get hourglass, as mentioned by Roguestoney here.. lol

Good luck on the rift, summoner.

Honestly? zed requiring the player to build an item whose main stat was useless against him was kind of a win win, the fact that you just invested a BF swords worth of gold into an item that has no combat benefits against him is pretty terrible! he counters his one counter

QSS should never have been a counter to him in the first place.

Personally i think the idea of deaths dance passive is a better option for ADCs against burst damage, something that smooths out damage spikes but doesnt reduce the actual damage done means that they can still be squishy but they at least have a chance to react before they bite the dust. All it does is turn the exact same damage from burst into damage over time, something that ADCs can actually cope with.

I think that buffing deaths dance passive to something ridiculous would be a good start, QSS just negated the damage, which makes zed feel bad and necessitated him to be balanced around the chance that his ult would do nothing, meaning more damage was pumped into his kit as compensation.
Damage deference on the other hand not so much as because his damage hasnt been negated, he doesnt need to have higher numbers elsewhere to compensate and his BS burst can be reacted to.

Something like 50% of damage dealt to the ADC is converted to a stacking DoT over 3 seconds.
The full damage is still dealt, so the ADC is no tankier than before, but the adc isnt immediately taken out of the fight.

That means that the adc now gets 3s of lifesteal to react before the ultimate kicking in
